main_text:
Logic || Summary
2.4 Summary


Sylvan’s approach to logic is of a piece with his work in
metaphysics and ethics: a polemical rebuke of the perceived powers of
the day—in the case of logic, the hegemony of classical
logic—and a highly imaginative and open-minded attitude towards
what sorts of entities—possible and impossible alike—our
best theories should condone. We turn now to these other aspects of
his work.
